headline: Could Sen. Marco Rubio derail GOP's tax reform push?
subHeadline: Republican senator from Florida signals he'll vote against the current tax reform plan unless a larger child tax credit is included; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everyone. I'm Kimberly Guilfoyle along with Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, Dana Perino and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City and this is "The Five." President Trump promised Americans a giant tax cut for Christmas. He expressed confidence again today it's happening. Republicans plan to unveil a final merged house and Senate bill tomorrow with the aim of voting sometime early next week. Will it pass? Republican senator Marco Rubio says he's a no unless the child tax credit for the working poor is expanded. The president believes the senator will come around.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I think he'll be there. He's really been a great guy, very supportive. I think that Senator Rubio will be there. We're doing very well on the tax front. We have tremendous support. We have tremendous spirit. It will be the largest tax cut in the history of our country. And I will say the Republican senators and congressmen and women have been incredible. So I think we will get there. It will be in a very short period of time. It will be the greatest Christmas present that a lot of people have ever received. It will be something special.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: "Something special." Well, the Senate Democratic leader is calling for the tax code to be delayed until Alabama's new senator-elect Doug Jones is seated.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CHUCK SCHUMER, D-N.Y.
utterances.sentences: It will be wrong for Senate Republicans to jam through this tax bill without giving the newly elected senator from Alabama the opportunity to cast his vote.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. Dana, so this is to be expected by Schumer because, of course, they don't want this to go through, so anything that they can do to be obstructionist to prevent this from being implemented is to be expected.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yeah, and it's not going to happen. And also, I read today that they said like it's some false deadline, but the Republicans have always said they wanted to get this to the president's desk before Christmas, at the end of the year. And so, it's been right on track, and this is before the Washington Post story came out about Roy Moore. The deadline that the Republican set was after Obamacare repeal and replace failed. So, that's not going to happen. They're not going to wait. I think the Democrats -- they're trying to find something to say. But I thought today was really interesting to watch the president. He's just so close to getting this done. I think it to be expected that you would have a couple members who really want something to press their advantage right now because there is this deadline. They do want a little bit more on the child tax credit. We can debate the merit of that. Ivanka Trump wants that as well. So, they know that they have a chance to possibly get that. I don't think that at the end of this that they will actually not vote for it. There could be a little bit of room to play with on the corporate rate because the president wanted 15, agreed to 20. Now it's at 21. Marco Rubio's point is, well, going to 22 percent isn't that big a deal. The corporations are still going to be happy and we could actually do more to help the working poor. I don't know if that will be persuasive, but it could be with the president.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. So a little bit of last-minute negotiations and deal making, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yeah. He's using his leverage, and he probably going to be effective because the deadline is fast approaching. I think this deal is much better than what we saw before. I don't love the tax cut. It's not big or bold enough, but it's gotten better in conference. They're dropping the top rate from 39 right now to 37, which is going to have a similitude effect. That's good. And 20 percent is better than 25 percent for the corporate rate reduction, which is also positive. And the Obamacare mandate, Juan, that will get repealed and that is a huge accomplishment for the Republican congress. No one thought that was even going to happen. And then, we talked about this, people who live in high tax states like New York and California will be able to deduct your state and local taxes up to 10,000. Not all of it, but up to 10,000, so that's a goof thing. So I think this train is moving towards the station and it's going to happen. I don't know if it's going to be the best Christmas present everyone is going to get because it's not as generous towards, I think, lower class and middle class Americans. It's also about $38 a week, but it's better than nothing. And it's very similitude.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: You've got to laugh when you say that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Why, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This is so absurd. This is such a giveaway to the rich. You might as well.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The rich pay more taxes, so they're going to get more money back.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Ebenezer Scrooge, America.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: They're celebrating a giveaway to not only the rich, but to the corporation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's not a giveaway if you keep more of your own money.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What happened to Donald Trump, man of the people, I'm going to take care of the forgotten man, the middle class. I'm going to create jobs.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: But that's what he's trying to do.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Even the corporations say it's not going to create jobs.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me just say this is so absurd and crude and rude and unfair in the Christmas season. But let me say something to what Dana was talking about. This thing is far shakier than anybody wants to pretend. All the Republicans want to do is say this is on a train, we're leaving the station. It's about to happen. It's not only -- not only do have Bob Corker, rightly, as a true conservative worried about blowing up the deficit, but you have Marco Rubio now saying, hey, what about working people? What about the working poor? What about Mike Lee? He's on the edge too. What about McCain and Corker? Both of them sick. May not be able to vote. And then, of course, Doug Jones. If Doug Jones gets in there and he's the rightly elected senator from Alabama, and it's only because Mitch McConnell wants to play parliamentary games that his sitting is being delayed, then all all of a sudden, the math shifts radically against this horrible bill.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Dana, rebuttal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, the only think I would add that there's another thing that's happening here, the house always talked about that they pass all these bills and gets stalled in the Senate. Actually, what happens is Senate has a different procedure. The other thing in addition to the individual mandate getting repeal that the Republicans have wanted for a really long time and it's not been possible is drilling in Anwar. And that actually would be a part of this bill.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: See, the reindeer gets celebrating.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. Greg, how do you see it so far? You like it a little bit better now.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: , CO-HOST: Juan just said the reindeer are celebrating. I thought it was about the people. Now you're worried about the reindeer.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: She's talking about drilling in Anwar.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's good. That helps people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That helps the reindeers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The more energy independent we are the better, we are more self- reliance and.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Better for the economy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's better for everybody.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I feel bad about the reindeer. Look, all Juan is doing is he's doing what the Democrats do. They always block agendas by using the same tools which is fear, hyperbole, bad hair, everything is the end of the world. It's the apocalypse meets Mad Max. You know, with apocalypse now floater. Everything is awful. That's why nobody believes you. I don't mean you, Juan, but the left, because everything is the end of the world. That neutrality repealed today. I swear to God, I thought -- if you saw the headlines of CNN, the end of the internet as you know it. Everything - - again, you can't -- no Democrat can accuse anybody of jamming anything.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They spent eight years of jamming stuffed down our throats. So this whole process has been very slow I think. And under Trump, which is quite possibly the most transparent presidency I've lived in. You see everything -- it's not pretty -- it's not pretty, but you're learning. You learn about the media, how the media lies. You learn about all the infighting. You learn about the flaws of the presidency. You learn about everything.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What flaws, Gutfeld?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're absolutely right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Modern-day presidency, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But Greg, hold on a second, you don't think this thing has been pushed through and jammed down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, no. It's been going around. It's actually been tinkered with.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: People actually read this, unlike Obamacare.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh no, in fact, I think hypocrisy is absolutely ranked on this, given that you complained, oh, what about Nancy Pelosi saying you have to pass it to know what's in it. That's exactly what's going on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now we do know what's in it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What's the promise to reveal, Kimberly? The promise to Rubio is, oh, don't worry about it, says President Trump. We'll make some kind of deal. This is going to happen. It's only because they don't have any legislative accomplishments and they're dying to have then.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what's amazing about that though -- we have so many people consumed by Russian collusion and palace infighting, you say nothing's happened? Deregulation, pipelines, Anwar, the Paris accord, tightening relationships with China, India and Russia. Repealing the mandate. A lot has been happening. So keep chasing Russia. Keep complaining. We'll get stuff done.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: How about all the unrest in the Middle East thanks to oh Trump?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, Trump. Oh, Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Did that just happen?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: More Juan fake news. All right. Dana, I want to come to you, talk to you about Paul Ryan, because there were some reports today that House Speaker Paul Ryan is actually considering leaving congress after the midterm election. Here's what the White House response to these rumors.

utterances.speaker: SARAH SANDERS, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: The president did speak to the speaker not too long ago and made sure that the speaker knew very clearly and in no uncertain terms that if that news was true, he was very unhappy with it. The speaker assured the president that those were not accurate reports, and that they look forward to working together for a long time to come.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. Dana, so White House communications coming out with a swift response.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: In support of Ryan, and saying the president would be unhappy. I mean, this is different because of this had been -- this news would come out maybe four months ago, the president might have said good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. But I think we've seen a couple things happen that are different, there's been personnel changes in the White House. You see the president actually thinking, oh, wait a second, they are trying to actually pass my agenda. Passing a lot of bills in the house and getting some of the stuff done in the Senate where they can, but also being supportive, especially on judges in particular.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And then, you have the Paul Ryan's office saying no, this is not happening, it's not happening. Now, I will just say that's what Speaker Boehner's office said right up until the day that he made it -- kind of a sudden decision if you read the political piece that says overnight, he woke up and he was like, you know what, I think I'm good here, and he resigns all of a sudden. So I don't think that's necessarily going to happen, but I think it is interesting and good if you're a Republican to say, OK, now they all look like we're on the same team with President Trump as the head coach and pulling people together, if they do get this bill passed, the tax reform bill with the other pieces that are in it. I think that successful feel good to them, and they'll be able to figure out what they can do in a second year which is not a lot, legislatively. Those are usually the most difficult.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I think they're up against some really challenging days ahead in the short terms in terms of budget issues, spending.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Always are.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And I don't think it's going to be happy times for Paul Ryan. He wants to do a big cut in terms of entitlement spending. So, you know, social security, Medicare and the like. This is going to be hugely controversial, even among.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Will it be the end of the world, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, no.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's rude, it's rude, and it's a giveaway to the rich.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Puppies will be crushed under a steamroller of hate.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You love to say these things because you want the rich to just do what they want.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hate the poor.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So we're talking about tax cuts. We're talking entitlement reform. Oh, don't touch that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Where the spending cuts coming from?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, so take it away from grandma. Push her over the cliff.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He's actually helping to make our case.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Scare tactics, that's all they have.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, yeah. If you had a real bill, Kimberly, if it was really tax reform, I think America would say great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I do think -- the president campaigned on a 33 percent top rate. So he wanted to go from 39 percent to 33 percent. The president and all of the Republicans ran on that. That's not what this bill is at. It was at 39 percent and he was OK with that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He should be thrilled.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Actually, Juan, I think you guys.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Compromise.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't want anything to go down.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No. First of all, if it was a case that our economy was struggling with the current tax.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know this argument.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: But the economy is doing well.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You don't want to make America great again.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: America is great, in my opinion, apparently, not yours.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What's the unemployment rate? How's the stock market, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is that Obama's fault? You're going to take credit for that too?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You bet this is Obama's economy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There's so much revenue with the federal government, it is an all-time high, we can afford to give some money back to the people who earned it themselves.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Ebenezer Scrooge speaking to America.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're greedy if you want to keep part of your paycheck.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You've check the box, no more taxes voluntarily, Juan. The little box there. Have you ever checked it? Have you ever checked it? I doubt it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, oh, you've just saw Juan got crushed. OK, ahead. Was she fired, was she dragged out of the White House after storming at the president's Trump residence? You can't make it up. Omarosa tells her side of what sounds like a wild story.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Omarosa is out of the White House. We've heard the rumors chief of staff John Kelly fired her. Then, the former Apprentice star allegedly stormed the president residence to find him and she got dragged out. She says none of that is true in her first interview since the announcement.

utterances.speaker: OMAROSA
utterances.sentences: I wanted to make the one-year mark. That was one of the goals that I've set out too. And then get back to my life. I like to hear all of these interesting tales, but I have to tell you that they're 100 percent false.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Did you try to enter the residence? Did that happen?

utterances.speaker: OMAROSA
utterances.sentences: It is ridiculous to assert that anyone would be able to violate the security parameters that is outlined in the most secure building in the world.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Were you escorted out?

utterances.speaker: OMAROSA
utterances.sentences: No, I was not. I think you should take the word of the U.S. secret service over someone who has a personal vendetta to bring me down, and they personally gained by continuing to advance these false narratives.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: As to our reports, Omarosa wanted out because she wasn't happy with the president's handling of Charlottesville and Roy Moore, listen.

utterances.speaker: OMAROSA
utterances.sentences: There were a lot of things that I observed during the last year that I was very unhappy with, that I was very uncomfortable with. Things I observed, I observed, that I listen to.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Such as?

utterances.speaker: OMAROSA
utterances.sentences: Because I can't expand upon it because I have to still go back and work with these individuals, but when I have a chance to tell my story, Michael, quite a story to tell. As the only African- American woman in this White House as a senior staff and assistant to the president, I have seen things that have made me uncomfortable, that have upset me, that have affected me deeply and emotionally. It has affected my community and my people. And when I can tell my story it is a profound story that I know the world will want to hear.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: President Trump has these brief words about her earlier.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I like Omarosa. Omarosa is a good person. Thank you all very much.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's it, OK. Jesse, have any insight scope on this? You've got lots of sources down there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, no. I do not have the inside scoop on Omarosa, but she does rub people the wrong way. I've met her a few times. She's been nice to me a few times. Other times she corrected the way a pronounced Omarosa. I still don't know if I have it correctly. I don't like how the media has treated her. The whole thing. So Trump hires a very intelligent successful black woman, and what they do is they say, oh, she's a joke. And then, when he fires an intelligent and successful black woman, they say, oh, you can't do that. Where's the diversity? So it's like no matter what Trump does he'll be criticized. I think she stuck around so long because she's so loyal and we know the president values loyalty. I don't really know what she did in the White House. I still think that's a question a lot people are asking. It was the office of -- it's a public liaison. So you build support with outside groups for the president's agenda.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Sounds like you know what she did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I believe -- well, I don't know if I've seen a lot of results in that department because I think there's a lot of opportunity there when you think of all the things he's put forward to generate a lot more support when it comes of people in congress, outside groups, associations or corporations.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I thought one of the toughest questions that Sarah Sanders got today, Kimberly, was the question of, so she got fired yesterday or resigned, whatever. She's escorted out. She's not there any longer, but she gets to be paid by the taxpayers until January 20, because she said she wanted to last a year. So maybe her book title would be, my year at the White House.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's your inside scoop.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm just assuming.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah. That means that is true. She's going to be paid for the remainder of the year. So maybe that's sort of the deal that she brokered, you know, on her way out. Therefore, it's a full year. But also, you have other people that were there have stayed on the books for a period of time as well. Like Reince Priebus and things like that. So, we'll see what happens. I think it's very clear from the tease there when she was talking about that she tried to, you know, push a book. She's going to tell her story and we'll see who she, you know, identifies and lays out in terms of people that she was unhappy with about their policies or viewpoints. I mean, one thing is she's a savvy businesswoman. She got a story to tell, so you've got to be aware of that when you hire somebody in that capacity.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I guess, rumors might not be true, but it is kind of fun to imagine her storming the east wing, demanding to see the president.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's an American tragedy. Trump lost a stalker. She was the official stalker. She trafficked on the idea that she had a special relationship with your boss. If you've ever worked in a place where somebody claims that they have a special relationship, it's a fabrication, it's a way to like -- kind of rub your face in it. But you know what, I see a huge potential here for a reality show. Who's out this week? You've got Omarosa. You've got Roy Moore. Roymarosa? They move into a house in Alabama and they live together, and they just see how things work out. It's kind of like the worst idea I've ever had.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It sounds like a drink.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Or they can get contributor ship at a cable TV network providing some insightful commentary about the goings-on in the White House.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Juan, let me ask you for a quick comment because we've got some news break.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, obviously, what's striking here is the John Kelly, the chief of staff, really couldn't stand and really was pushing to get her out, and that's the inside story. And then, the question is exactly how she got pushed out. But to me, she didn't do the job that Jesse articulated, which is to build relationships with the black community or anybody else. And Jesse, her primary credential that she was a celebrity, that she was a celebrity who got fired on Celebrity Apprentice.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This woman had no reason -- I mean, black, white, Asian -- I don't care what. There was no reason for her to be there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Manage to maneuver herself to a very prestigious position. So, she's obviously intelligent.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, yeah, that's great. In other words, everybody who was on a hustle deserves to be there?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're calling her a hustler?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She was definitely better than Gary Busey, the other choice.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, I didn't realize.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. We have breaking news tonight regarding the FBI's investigation into the Hillary Clinton email scandal. Some brand-new development right after this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Breaking news on the Clinton email investigation. Chief intelligence correspondent Catherine Herridge is live in D.C. with details. Catherine?

utterances.speaker: CATHERINE HERRIDGE, FOX NEWS CHIEF INTELLIGENCE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Well, thanks, Juan. Within the last 2 minutes, Fox News has obtained a letter that was sent this afternoon to FBI director Christopher Wray from the Senate homeland security committee. But what's key about this letter is we believe it's the first time we've seen one of the original drafts of Director Comey's exoneration statement from July of last year that recommended against criminal charges in the Clinton email case. I have the five pages of that exoneration statement here. And we've been combing through it here at Fox News. And there're really two big takeaways. Number one, this term, grossly negligent, was removed from the draft at least twice and it was downgraded to extremely careless, and that was the language that Director Comey used in his public statement. And we know based on our reporting that the removal of the term grossly negligent was made by this FBI agent Peter Strzok, who sent these anti-Trump texts. The reason that term matters is because gross negligence is the legal standard under the federal statute for prosecution for the mishandling of classified information. The other key thing, and we haven't seen this in any media reports until now, is that they made a change about the likelihood that a hostile actor was able to penetrate Hillary Clinton's email server. And the original drafts said that given the combination of factors, talking about the lack of security with the server and the fact that it was a target, we assess it is reasonably likely that hostile actors gained access to Secretary Clinton's private email account. And in the public statement by Director Comey, that was downgraded to the term, possible, that they access the Clinton email server, and the hundreds of classified messages that it contained. So bottomline, we've got one of the original drafts of the exoneration statement. It shows a key term grossly negligent was dropped, softened at least twice, and that the original statement said that it was likely that the server had been accessed, have been hacked by foreign actors or hostile actors, and that was not included in that final public statement, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Catherine, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: HERRIDGE
utterances.sentences: You're welcome.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's so interesting. Dana, what do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, a couple of things. First of all, James Comey has resurfaced on Twitter, and he sends a few cryptic tweets now and then. They're usually in response to something that's happening in the news or to the president.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Tick-tock.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And -- not quite those. But I do think that -- I know that the investigations are ongoing, but at some point you have to wonder if, to the benefit of the FBI and to the American people, if there doesn't need to be some sort of public accounting by him sooner than later. I think that we -- I felt like I kind of knew the part about the removal of the standards, the "grossly negligent."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: "Grossly negligent" versus "extremely careless," yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I thought we sort of knew that. This question about, that it was reasonably likely, that still is not proof that it happened. So I don't know what Strzok was doing. Maybe he was pulling one over on James Comey or perhaps he was just persuasive either on the merits or for some other nefarious reason. But James Comey owns those words.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He's the one. When you sign off on it as the principal, when you speak them, they are yours. So Peter Strzok might've been a bad actor possibly. I don't know. But I do think that James Comey has to own it, and he probably should talk about it sooner than later.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So Kimberly...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: ... you're in the prosecution business. At least you used to be. So grossly negligent...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I still prosecute you every day, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Thank you. "Grossly negligent" versus "extremely careless." Some people say it's the same thing. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, no, it isn't. I mean, one is a higher standard and more egregious example of a violation here. That's why one would be prosecutable and one wouldn't. So in terms of the intention and what occurred, that would be persuasive. And then you would take something like this where you have that evidence, that information. Then it should be the purview of the A.G. to be able to decide, in fact, whether you should proceed forward on a charge. So that's, like, another example of, you know, James Comey overstepping his bounds by, in fact, trying to make the decision as to whether or not it would be sufficient evidence and rising to that level. So what it looks like is they actually tried to tip the scale.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And that is not the job of the FBI. And that's why what Dana is saying that he's going to have to make a statement about this and own it, because he's the one that got up there and read the statement and made that determination, et cetera. So I think we need to hear from him. We need to hear from Strzok. And it's very disturbing. And anybody, whether you're Republican or Democrat, declined to state and independent, you should be concerned about this. Because this goes to the heart of, you know, our top investigatory agency and the job that they needed to do to be fair and impartial.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Jesse and Greg, the other key point that Catherine said was, instead of the --saying that there was likely that it was the server being hacked, it just said possible. What do you guys make of that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you want us to answer it together?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Or...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's hold hands.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Go ahead, Greg.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You want me to say something?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: However you're most comfortable. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's the last time I throw a jump ball.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The edits show that they were going out of their way to help Hillary Clinton, which ironically preserved her candidacy, which then elected Donald Trump. By that election, ironically now, allowed us to find out that they went out of their way to help Hillary Clinton. This is what's so fantastic about this. That they -- what they did ended up creating the opposite result.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Opposite day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's true.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: An opposite presidency. That's what happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Crazy laugh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, I hate to correct you right to your face like this but last week...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't hate it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: ... we had a debate about whether or not it was hacked; and you said no, no, no.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It wasn't. That's what -- that's exactly what...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Now we have the FBI saying it was reasonably likely that it was penetrated, and then they decided, oh, it was possible. So either way, there's a chance it was hacked.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: In other words, they don't have any proof. They don't have any proof.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But hackers don't leave footprints, Juan. That's why they're so sophisticated.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Get out of town.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What do you know about it?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What do you know?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: President Obama said on camera when he was asked about this, there is no national security at risk.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is just a small thing. So that goes against that. And this isn't the first time he's been pressured to change language. I know it was his underling here, but Loretta Lynch, the DOJ had, when she said, "I want you to call the investigation 'a matter.' Don't call it an investigation."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Remember that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: "Just call it 'a matter'." And he caved. So Comey has a record of being persuaded...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He has answered that. Come on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: ... by a bunch of people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He answered that, though.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What did he say?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He said that FBI investigations are matters. So he thought that it was, like, equal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But it's another example of him doing something to benefit the Hillary Clinton campaign.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, please. This is so ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Which elected Trump. That's the beauty of this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me just say you should not go into a case with some kind of prejudice against the person being investigated. And yet you guys now say, "Oh, yes..."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But that's what the president's supporters are saying now about Strzok regarding the Mueller investigation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But there was no prejudice against Hillary or Trump but that doesn't serve the conspiracy theories.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, there was.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me just...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We talked about it all this week, Juan. The attacks...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, you get out of town. Mr. Conspiracy here. Ahead on "The Five," Mr. Gregory on campus coddling patrol. Why some colleges have now turned into petting zoos. Next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: To help fight stress of upcoming finals, colleges are using therapy llamas. University of South Florida and Radford University are trucking in llamas and other beasts to help students cope. So this is great for the students, poor things. But what about the llamas who have to absorb the noxious, annoying angst of fragile idlers as they moan about their insulated existence and perhaps the easiest phase of their comfy lives? Yes, some studies show that pets lower stress, but what about the stress of the pet? Talk about torture. Imagine being a llama and you're bussed miles from the comforts of a pleasant petting zoo only to have some whiny bozo with issues running their bony, stinky fingers through your gorgeous fur. Imagine a poor bunny -- yes, they're using bunnies, too -- forced to sit on the lap of a gender studies major griping about how studying has really cut into her social justice puppetry theater. I'd put these critters on suicide watch, because if I were an alpaca, guinea pig or a slow loris, I'd hurl myself into traffic before becoming a stress sponge for these pampered slackers. And where will this end anyway? When these precious pupils graduate, how will they handle the real world? Will llamas accompany you to a job interview? Yes, that will go over well. Well, unless it's this one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My stress levels have already plummeted. Thanks, Lorenzo.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wow. Was that a real block?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It is a real block, Kimberly, and I'm going to you first. Isn't this animal abuse? The poor llamas are having a good time, and they've got to sit there and be petted by, like, neurotic kids.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Don't they, like, spit viciously at you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They can.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, really. If you'd get too close and try to mess with it. So this might be the llamas' revenge. This is all, like...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's, like, gross spit, too.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's really -- I think it's not good. It might be, like...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what you do? You go there, if they spit -- you have them spit on your driver's license, and it is llama-nating.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Very good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, boy. Producers, you let them do this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know. Animal abuse?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I -- I had a very different college experience.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I had No-Doz. In finals, I'd just pop No-Doz. You remember those pills?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, you had speed. That's what it was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Anybody has any, you know my address.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I never tried one of those. I was too afraid.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. GUILFOYLE:

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm surprised that fraternity boys haven't stolen the llamas and gone and, like, drank with it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Can I ask a question? Why do you...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's what they do.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Why do you regularly beat up on college students?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I do not regularly beat them up. I'm not even allowed on the campuses, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Neither is Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: By court order.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Jesse, you're never allowed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Colleges aren't -- most college students are now becoming more conservative, more libertarian, because they're rebelling against the social justice...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: The antithesis of it, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're the new rebels.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Excuse me, where did you go to college?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I went to Berkeley. But that's a long time ago.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Mr. Left-wing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Berzerkly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think the llamas are at Berkeley. Isn't that -- that was it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They came over to UC Davis now. We used to be normal. I don't know what happened.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I just think college is pretty competitive and even to get into Berkeley, you've got to be really good. And then to succeed, I think...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Top 3 percent of the country.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So why are you picking -- why are you making them into snowflakes?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Here's -- here. You know what it is? I see what you're saying, Juan. You know that the Democratic Party needs llamas. Because Trump is breaking the brain.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And so you need to pet. Like to get through this week, you've got to pet a llama.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Send those llamas to Alabama.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: A llama in 'Bama.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Actually, I think it's -- I think it's fine. Let them have the pets.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think it's so ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm having a llama on my show next weekend.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. And exclusive. Llama exclusive. We're going to talk to one of these llama professors.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: By the way, if they do social media with a lot of it, how are you going to get a job in the future if they're, like, hanging out with llamas and needing comfort and stress reduction? You have spit all over your face? No one wants you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: If you went to Conservative U., they'd cut that llama up into steaks. That's what they'd do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Or booze (ph).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hope so. All right. An update on Piegate next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I like him. Why are you mean?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not a Lenny Kravitz fan, I guess, Gutfeld?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Remember Piegate? It's back. Press secretary Sarah Sanders tweeting out some new pictures to prove she can bake perfect pecan pies. Trolling reporter April Ryan, who accused her list time of posting fakes. Today at the press potluck, Sanders presented them to Ryan, and here's what happened.

utterances.speaker: SARAH HUCKABEE SANDERS, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: I can't believe you would question my ability to make a pie.

utterances.speaker: APRIL RYAN, JOURNALIST
utterances.sentences: It was a joke.

utterances.speaker: SANDERS
utterances.sentences: I'm from the South.

utterances.speaker: RYAN
utterances.sentences: At the beginning it was a joke. So what? You could be from the south and you can't cook. A lot of people can't cook. She doesn't like that. It was a joke at the beginning. It went awry. And -- but I look at this as a reset. I think this is an earnest attempt for you to reach out to all of us, not just to me.

utterances.speaker: SANDERS
utterances.sentences: That's true. I try to reach out to you guys every day, but this is, I think, a great time. It's Christmas. And it's a time to be generous, hospitable which I try to do every day. But particularly for you today.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, it's a reset.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is that going to work?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't know. Putin. Maybe Putin is next. A pie for Putin.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Like the reset button.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Kimberly, was this -- did they bury the hatchet? Or are they still going to hate each other the next day.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Pie in your face.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Your face. On April's face.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Like, you know what? Here you go. No fake news. I know how to bake, and here's what's happening. And she doubled it up. I liked that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: April looked a little apologetic.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But April confirmed what I said the first day, was that she was joking.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That it was a joke, yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Why are they taking it so seriously? I don't think I ever made a single thing for the press corps.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Or my husband. I don't cook very well at all. I did make these no-bake cookies one time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No bake?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, they're called no-bake cookies. And this is when we lived in England. And I was very proud of them. And they're supposed to be, like, very healthy. And they really did look like...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No-bake cookies?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But they tasted good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wait a second. You made that queso that time that was good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I can make queso. That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's cheese for people that don't speak Spanish. Greg Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God. Thanks, Rosetta Stone. Please.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is nothing but "bake" news.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is not a real one for sure...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The media immediately took half the pie and wanted to give it to the Department of Pie Consumption. That's all I've got. I've got nothing on this. I wanted to talk about something else.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Move to the next batch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I got a Payday.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He keeps holding that up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Speaking of food, I got this. They still sell these. It's peanuts and caramel. It's delicious.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wasn't it your prop in the A-block?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I haven't eaten all day. I hadn't eaten, so...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How can you resist opening it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm going to wait until after the show, and then I'm going to shove it down my throat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You have more of those, by the way?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I don't. But I'll -- I'll give you half of it. And we'll just be like the government.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Redistributed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It will be a giveaway.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Give him 37 cents.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Juan will be happy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Spread the Payday around.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Giveaway to the rich. Just give it to Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, Juan gets nothing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes, and you know what? And you know what? Greg has a peanut allergy. So give him a Payday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm glad you said "peanut."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: How murderous of you!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. It's time now for "One More Thing." I'll begin with myself, since I am so prepared with this one. I love it. So this is our first lady, Melania, visiting kids and sorting through Toys for Tots donations before making holiday cards with military children and getting into the holiday spirit. And by the way, for the record, I saw the White House, the decorations and everything for the holiday Christmas party, and they were absolutely beautiful. Not scary at all. I thought they were really well done. But anyway, so take a look at this.

utterances.speaker: MELANIA TRUMP, FIRST LADY
utterances.sentences: It is my hope that during this holiday season, people will remember it is not about gifts. It is about family, service, and gratitude. We must continue to look out for and help each other.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Beautiful message from our first lady. All right. Go ahead, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, thanks. Hey, it's a birthday weekend in my house. So today is my son Raffi's birthday. Happy birthday. And my wife's birthday, Delise's birthday, is coming up. So happy birthday, everybody. Now, check out this adorable video. It's gone viral. A toddler running to the rescue of his big sister during a wrestling match that he thought was real, that it was a real fight. So watch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That is the best thing I've ever seen.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That is a good brother.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He is a good brother. He was out to protect his sister. It's adorable.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Isn't that nice?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do you think you would've done that, Jesse? For Eliza?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Maybe when she was older in her teen years when the boys came knocking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I -- how can you condone this? No, this is blatant sexism. That -- thinking that, oh, the little boy has to go out and help the girl. Because the girl is in trouble. This is pure patriarchal male privilege to allow the -- I think -- I think they have to arrest the entire family.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, God. Why don't you go pet a llama in the corner, Gutfeld?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They have to arrest the family. That should arrest the family.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right? He's just so offended.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I didn't know little kids wrestle. Little girls wrestle. Anyway.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my -- how sexist is that? Why can't girls wrestle?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You think just boys can wrestle? I've seen little girls crush little boys at wrestling. And in fact, I used to do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know that I'm -- I don't see gender, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So just stop it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: If you saw big girls wrestle, you'd notice gender.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, please.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Time for...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, from the top rope.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hate these people!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, I love AirBNB. I think it's an amazing thing. People can go and find places to live. But I hate the people who use it. If you're going to move -- if you're going to rent somebody's apartment, you better realize that they have neighbors, so you don't treat the neighbors like they're somehow some kind of hotel guests. No, that's where we live. So don't be leaving your trash out in front of my door! Because I will hunt you down, and I will kill you!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I will kill you!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wow, what a total psycho. OK. I can't. I don't know what to do now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I hate people who leave their trash. All right. They have no respect.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No respect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No respect. And by the way the people that rent their places out, I'm coming for you, too.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, why don't you talk to your neighbor about it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Big problem. And I love AirBNB. I think AirBNB's great. But the people that do it, they've got to...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: How does AirBNB exist without the people that rent it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The people need to treat these places with more -- treat the neighbors with more respect. They come in and they party very hard, and they don't care about the neighbors.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You need to have, with your homeowners' association or condo board, a meeting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I am. I am.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That will include this kind of activity.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm on the board, Kimberly. We're talking about you specifically.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, this explains everything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think it's you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Not at all. I'm far from homeless.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We need a break. Thank you. We need a break.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Let's be honest. Llama boy. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's hard to follow Rodney Dangerfield over here, but I'm going to try. All right. It's so hard to get into Harvard. One of the best schools in the country. It's even harder when you're 16. But this kid got into Harvard, Ayrton Little, and watch his reaction. Go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sixteen years old, just got accepted into probably the best college in the country. And wow. When I was 16, I didn't have a shot. Not even close.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So great.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Didn't even apply.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Harvard is so overrated.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Coming from Berkeley. The Berkeley boy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Harvard is a poor man's Berkeley.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Really, this is another opportunity for him to have Berkeley arrogance. You know that, right? It's like hello. I went to UC system, too. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is my "One More Thing."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Can I eat it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is a little Christmas cheer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Greg is going to be very happy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, oh yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: One for K.G.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Best part about Christmas. Is drinking to forget Christmas.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Juan. It's not wrapped, but it's still good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Look at that. Full-bodied...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The annual Jasper wine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You have your face on the bottle of the wine?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's perfect.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's personalized wine.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Did you bring a nipple for, you know, Gutfeld? The big crybaby over there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: At least you're not full of yourself, Dana.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Get Gutfeld a nipple.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, I'm just giving Jesse ideas for his future Christmas gifts.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This looks very presidential.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I do this, Juan, every year.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's cab. It's great; it's a great wine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Good wine, actually.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's Napa, California. PersonalWine.com.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Very good, very good. I'll drink this before I do Tucker tonight. I'm on Tucker tonight. I'll be smashed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You won't be able to tell the difference.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You won't tell the difference.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You mean you're on Tucker's show tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Then I'll be away. Then I'll be away for a week, you know, on a vacation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was smart to say. That was smart.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It will be Christmas, but...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Have we ruined "Special Report" yet?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, we're getting there, though.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I don't think so. Nobody could save it, but Bret Baier can. Can we go to him? Is he ready for us?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think I'll put the alcohol down. You never want to miss an episode of the coo-coo-kachoo over here. "Special Report" up next. Bret, over to you.
